dialogues.text: a kiss that seems to awaken them both from a spell of sad --- that’s all good, but suddenly

dialogues.speaker: THE TRAIN IS NO LONGER FLOATING THROUGH THE FOURTH DIMENS
dialogues.text: --- instead it is bucking and rocking and all the passeng from this morning are again surrounding them - devolving instantly into panic mode: THEY ARE TRAPPED IN A SUBWAY C AND SOMETHING IS WRONG. WINDOWS SHATTER -— reflecting, refracting the action into thousands of mirro images - Renee looks at Tupelo - what is this? Tupelo’s p has worked - but it ain’t pretty:

dialogues.speaker: TUPELO
dialogues.text: We’re trying to get back home ---

dialogues.speaker: IN CAR
dialogues.text: Surfaces are hard again, passengers being thrown from sid side as THE TRAIN BREAKS THROUGH INTO OUR SPACE AND TIME now #8686 is at the head of

dialogues.speaker: A RUNAWAY TRAIN
dialogues.text: WHEELS SCREECHING, SPIKES FLYING, SPARKS IGNITING, over-s detectors TEARING out of the tracks ---

dialogues.speaker: IN THE TRAIN
dialogues.text: the operator’s door slams open - no one’s inside --- Tupe leaps to the booth, reaches for the brake ---  105.

dialogues.speaker: IT GOES SOFT IN HIS HAND ---
dialogues.text: --- the train controls are still not back in our world -- Tupelo is thrown out of the booth to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: HE GRIPS THE HANDLE OF THE FRONT DOOR,
dialogues.text: pulls himself up, finds himself eye-to-eye with those old initials: RT - now angrily glowing. He whispers:

dialogues.speaker: TUPELO
dialogues.text: Sorry. The angry glow fires stronger, then fades - Tupelo forgiv He again launches himself into the control booth, pulls b the throttle and now --- THE FRICTION BRAKES ENGAGE, THE TRAIN SCREECHING into

dialogues.speaker: BERGEN STREET STATION ---
dialogues.text: --- now CAUGHT IN A TORNADO OF ENERGY - METAL SIGNS TEARI

dialogues.speaker: IN THE TRAIN
dialogues.text: Tupelo turns the key-switch to open all the doors, shouti

dialogues.speaker: TUPELO
dialogues.text: Everybody out. Get out - Now!

dialogues.speaker: WATER MAINS ABOVE THE TRACKS
dialogues.text: --- exit gates now open, passengers rush for the stairs - strangers helping strangers, Tupelo and Renee carrying children, helping old people, as ---

dialogues.speaker: A FLOOD OF WATER
dialogues.text: Crashes in from ruptured water tunnels - TUPELO AND RENEE RUSHING UPSTAIRS TO THE STREET look back downstairs to se

dialogues.speaker: CAR
dialogues.text: GROANING AND GASPING AND SCREECHING as it DROWNS in the f - sharing the sad fate of its fellow subway cars that wer dumped this morning in the Atlantic. TUPELO SEES: GLOWING through the dark water, THE FADING INITIALS --- “RT”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rescued, disoriented passengers see the street signs:  106.

dialogues.speaker: PASSENGERS
dialogues.text: What’s going on!!!? --- We just left Bergen Street!!! COPS, EMS, FIREMEN arrive, and there’s --- SOLJAK - with Tinkerbell and Jamal. Tinkerbell hugs Tupel Jamal punching his arm.

dialogues.speaker: JAMAL
dialogues.text: Mister Unreal. You did it.

dialogues.speaker: SOLJAK
dialogues.text: This your wife? Hello Renee. So Tupelo, you brought back my train!

dialogues.speaker: TUPELO
dialogues.text: Yeah, it’s back, but we need to cut the tracks somewhere - now! - break the loop before it happens again.

dialogues.speaker: SOLJAK
dialogues.text: We had to wait until you got back, right? Now that you’re back ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same tunnel where the shuttle tracks were first connected SHOWER OF SPARKS as a WELDER begins to dis-connect the st rails. The contractor moans to Terrell:

dialogues.speaker: CONTRACTOR
dialogues.text: I don’t get you people. The morn- ing he’s barking at me to finish the job now he’s barking at me to take it apart!?

dialogues.speaker: TERRELL
dialogues.text: He gives the orders. Not me. INT. MAYOR’S SPECIAL SHUTTLE TRAIN - NIGHT Stalled at Coney Island, lights off, dignitaries howling, and Michelle Murphy screaming into her cell phone:

dialogues.speaker: MICHELLE MURPHY
dialogues.text: I don’t care what he said! I give the orders: Turn on the power for this train! Do it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hand moves a switch, overrides the main circuit and a h  107. mile away the mayor’s special shuttle train lights up and starts moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A final blast of SPARKS. A section of shuttle tracks is separated. The Moebius Knot is cut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIRENS, CHAOS, CROWDS. Renee takes Tinkerbell’s bandaged

dialogues.speaker: RENEE
dialogues.text: I was worried for you.

dialogues.speaker: TINKERBELL
dialogues.text: And I was worried about you. Tupelo first now sees that Tinkerbell and Jamal are with Soljak - the cops want them, but one look from Soljak and the cops keep their distance. Soljak, impressed by Tinkerbell, to Tupelo:

dialogues.speaker: SOLJAK
dialogues.text: Kid knows more about the subway than I do. Where’d you find her? And this other one - asks me to name a vegetable. I say “cabbage” and he says “fuck you.” What's that about? Tupelo shrugs, innocent - goes to Renee and Tinkerbell wh are looking down into the flooding subway.

dialogues.speaker: TUPELO
dialogues.text: No one’s going to believe this.

dialogues.speaker: TINKERBELL
dialogues.text: Except us.

dialogues.speaker: RENEE
dialogues.text: And me.

dialogues.speaker: SOLJAK
dialogues.text: And you’re all gonna keep quiet about it. It was a water main that busted, train got diverted, and now it’s here. End of story.

dialogues.speaker: JAMAL
dialogues.text: Who’s gonna believe that?  108.

dialogues.speaker: SOLJAK
dialogues.text: Okay then, I’1l say a train got lost in the 4th dimension.

dialogues.speaker: TUPELO
dialogues.text: Maybe we'd better stick with “the busted water main” version. But you did cut the line somewhere, right?

dialogues.speaker: SOLJAK
dialogues.text: Yes, Master. The knot’s broken. Take your wife and go home. I’11 keep an eye on these two. Tupelo and Renee hug the kids goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: RENEE
dialogues.text: Call me.

dialogues.speaker: TUPELO
dialogues.text: Stay out of trouble.

dialogues.speaker: JAMAL
dialogues.text: You stay out of trouble. You’re the crazy one. (to Soljak) Let’s try it again - what’s 2+2? Soljak motions to Renee and Tupelo: go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pushing through rescue workers, cops, reporters. Finally finds Soljak. Soljak raises a hand: stop.

dialogues.speaker: SOLJAK
dialogues.text: No Terrell. Please. Every time you open your mouth it’s bad news. So please --- (with Tinkerbell and Jamal) I made some new friends. Bother someone else. Call Michelle. I'm retired, effective now. I’m done here. I’m leaving. I quit.

dialogues.speaker: TERRELL
dialogues.text: (needs to speak) Chief, the special train, with Michelle and everyone and the mayor - someone musta turned the power back on before we broke the link, but - now that train’s missing!  109. Soljak growls. Soljak can’t leave. He’s part of the loop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beyond the crowd. Tupelo and Renee walking. City lights a stars above sparkling.

dialogues.speaker: RENEE
dialogues.text: Let’s start our life together all over. That okay? It’s all Tupelo has ever wanted to hear --- TUPELO’S VOICE That’s okay with me. --- life as an unending Moebius Strip. Tupelo and Renee, around each other, draw closer together - like interlocki spirals - and as they rejoin the world that we can see -- TUPELO TAKES OFF HIS GLASSES (the opposite of how our sto began), and THROUGH HIS EYES THE SCREEN BECOMES:

dialogues.speaker: OVERLAPPING AND FOLDING INTO EACH OTHER---
dialogues.text: --- a vision of how light and reality might really be. Then, amidst the sounds of the city, we hear --- - Tupelo! - --- and at the faint GROWL and SCREECH of a subway train somewhere beneath the city streets, we ---
